firstPersonCard.name: Nesterov Oleksandr Stanislavovych
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Development of methods for controlling and managing the metallurgical properties of charge materials, experimental research of their high-temperature characteristics with subsequent forecasting of their use for forming a rational raw material agglomeration and pig iron smelting technology, including with a high proportion of secondary resources. Development and technological support of methods and measures aimed at extending the campaign of blast furnaces, ensuring the formation of stable protective skull in the lower zone of the shaft, bosh and hearth of blast furnaces, as well as washing the blast furnace hearth from fine coke fractions. Research on possibilities for reducing carbon use in blast furnace production, including when using hydrogen.
firstPersonCard.specialization: 05.16.02 – Metallurgy of Ferrous, Non-Ferrous Metals and Special Alloys

items: System analysis of processes and prospects for the development of blast furnace pig iron production.
Development of scientific concepts about processes occurring in the blast furnace:
development of technological prerequisites for stable operation of blast furnaces in existing fuel and raw material conditions, in stationary and transitional smelting conditions;

development of principles for blast furnace operation in non-stationary conditions (blow-down and blow-in), technological support for bringing blast furnaces to normal stable operation during deep disturbances in their operation;

development of a comprehensive mathematical model of blast furnace smelting based on accounting for the influence of uneven distribution of materials throughout the furnace volume on smelting indicators;
mastering energy-saving technologies for pig iron smelting;
development of scientific foundations for the mechanisms of stable protective skull formation.

Improvement of iron ore raw material agglomeration and pig iron smelting technology based on managing the metallurgical properties of charge materials, including those with high secondary resource content, development of methods for optimizing the metallurgical value of the charge to ensure the required quality of pig iron.
Development of non-traditional low-coke and coke-free blast furnace smelting technologies.
Providing consultations and conducting expert examinations for industrial enterprises:
Expert assessment of design solutions for the charging device considering the achievement of required smelting indicators;
Consultations on the selection of control means and technical solutions in projects for new blast furnaces or during their reconstruction or modernization;

Development of technical specifications for design with recommendations for reconstruction of lining and cooling systems, profile improvement, modernization of charging equipment, charging system and automatic control system;
Technological adjustment of the charging device;
Assessment of actual furnace profile parameters using high-precision laser measuring equipment.
Development and implementation of automated control systems (ACS) and expert systems:
Thermal-gas dynamic model of the 'dry' zone of the blast furnace and determination of the cohesive zone position;
ACS for thermal operation and lining wear of the furnace shaft;
ACS for thermal operation and lining wear of the blast furnace hearth;
ACS for external heat losses and coke consumption for their compensation;
Model for calculating the charge and distribution parameters at the blast furnace top.
